current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: Celebrating the 2014 Arctic Winter Games, in Fairbanks, Alaska.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

action-desc.#text: Committee discharged; considered and agreed to

text.#text:
congratulates the dedicated athletes, coaches, volunteers, leaders, and staff who contribute to the
			 mission and success of the 2014 Arctic Winter Games;

welcomes the return of the Arctic Winter Games to Fairbanks, Alaska, for the first time since 1988;
			 and

celebrates the continuing friendly competition among northern circumpolar countries and the great
			 cultural exchange that keeps northern traditions alive.

Whereas the Arctic Winter Games, as envisioned over 40 years ago by Alaska Governor Wally Hickel
			 and commissioners from the Northwest Territories and Yukon, continues to
			 promote the core values of its creation: athletic competition, cultural
			 exhibition, and social interchange;

Whereas the State of Alaska is proud to contribute to the Arctic Winter Games 287 Alaskan athletes,
			 ages 13 to 24; and

Whereas the 2014 Arctic Winter Games marks the fifth Arctic Winter Games hosted in Alaska since the
			 first competition in 1970: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 387 ATS: Celebrating the 2014 Arctic Winter Games, in Fairbanks, Alaska.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
